title: National Museum of Funeral History presents Annual Haunted House
address: 415 Barren Springs Dr. Houston, TX 77090 United States
body: Get in to the Halloween spirit all month long and be “scared to death” at this family-friendly haunted house. Explore different scenes designed to give goose bumps to young and old alike while taking a light-hearted view of a usually very serious subject. Admission: Tickets are $3 - $5.

title: The Starry Messenger at Rice University Moody Center
address: 6100 Main St. Houston, Texas 77005 United States
body: Artist Diana Thater’s The Starry Messenger is a nine-monitor video installation of the ever-shifting and evolving Milky Way. It was filmed at Griffith Observatory Planetarium in Los Angeles and shot from below the massive Zeiss star projector, and it’s on view for the next year at the new Moody Center for the Arts at Rice University. Admission: Free

title: Toddler Tuesdays at Discovery Green
address: 1500 Mckinney St Houston, TX 77010 United States
body: Bring your toddler to Discovery Green park to enjoy a new storybook and activities each week. Admission This event is free to attend.

title: Theater District Food Truck Tuesdays
body: Theater District Houston kicks off another tasty season of Food Truck Tuesdays. Enjoy a rotating cast of local food trucks week in and week out in downtown’s scenic Theater District. Admission: Free.

title: Hansel and Gretel at Miller Outdoor Theatre
address: 6000 Hermann Park Drive Houston, TX 77030 United States
body: The famous fairy tale from the Brothers Grimm, Hansel and Gretel, comes to operatic life in a 45-minute, family-friendly production at Miller Outdoor Theatre. Admission This event is free to attend.

title: A Day to Remember live at the Revention Music Center
address: 520 Texas Ave. Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: A Day to Remember comes to Houston in support of their sixth album, Bad Vibrations. Admission: tickets start at $34.

title: Taco Tuezday at Aloft Downtown Houston
address: 820 Fannin St Houston, Texas 77002 United States
body: Who doesn't love a good taco, especially on a Tuezday. Well, check us out. $2 Tacos, $3 Tequila Sunrizez, and $4 Margaritas.

title: Alley Theatre presents Describe the Night
address: 3351 Cullen Blvd. Houston, TX 77204 United States
body: Check out the world premiere of Describe the Night, a play that tells the story of men and women, spies, conspiracy theories, and the ever onward passage of time. Admission Tickets start at $16.

title: Star Wars Trivia Night at Flying Saucer Sugar Land
address: 15929 City Walk Sugar Land, TX United States
body: Every Tuesday throughout the month of October, we’ll have five special trivia nights. Here’s the breakdown: Tuesday, Oct. 3 – Star Wars Trivia Tuesday, Oct. 10 – Harry Potter Trivia Tuesday, Oct. 17 – Friends Trivia Tuesday, Oct. 24 – Game of Thrones Trivia Tuesday, Oct. 31 – Trick or Trivia. Admission: Free to Attend

title: Fat Tony at Walters Downtown
body: On Tuesday, you can get all close and personal when Houston's Fat Tony returns from L.A. over at Walter's. Tony has been on a tear since moving out West and his latest drop, MacGregor Park, is his best to date. Add to that a crazed live show and this should be a worthwhile homecoming and then some. The heavy bars of Indiana's F L A C O will open the all-ages show. Admission: tickets start at $10.

title: The Bayou City Showcase Songwriters Night
address: 2957 Bingle Rd. Houston, TX 77055 United States
body: A gathering of local, regional, and sometimes traveling, songwriters performing in an acoustic open mic format. All are welcome to participate and/or listen. Full bar and food available. This is a long-standing series that began in the Montrose and Heights area of Houston. It has recently found a permanent home at The Americana in Spring Branch. Mark Zeus hosts. Admission: Free to Attend.
